name: NPR
text:
In her childhood art classes, Jennifer Steinkamp used to make trees with sponges and paint. 

These days, her hypnotic trees pop up at museums and in private collections all over the world. Take a peek üëá
https://t.co/1TXJ0XCsdL

name: NPR
text: RT @nprmusic: Phil Elverum (@PWElverum) has built and battled entire universes. On 'Microphones in 2020,' a 45-minute track out Friday, he acts not as nostalgist but as time traveler. @totalvibration talks to Elverum about the first album by The Microphones in 17 years. https://t.co/ADXiKFYbdx https://t.co/fBo2RDtA3a

name: NPR
text:
Mississippi was the last state to include the Confederate battle emblem on its flag. So far, the public has submitted nearly 3,000 proposals for a new flag.   
https://t.co/d5bpAaSlDQ

name: NPR
text:
Moderna has priced its experimental coronavirus vaccine around $32 and $37 per dose for foreign countries. 

But given the upfront investment by the government, there are sharp questions about the eventual U.S. price. https://t.co/Osu2FFuGdm

name: NPR
text:
UPDATE: Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine says he has now tested negative for COVID-19. He tested positive earlier today, ahead of a planned meeting with President Trump.
https://t.co/7pCmqDjeoe

name: NPR
text:
Defense Secretary Mark Esper urged Beijing to be transparent about the coronavirus pandemic in a 90-minute call with Defense Minister Wei Fenghe that comes amid deteriorating U.S.-China relations.
https://t.co/lUPTxnr97r

name: NPR
text:
NEW: President Trump issued an order banning U.S. business transactions with TikTok's Chinese parent company in 45 days. He also signed an order restricting U.S. business with the owner of WeChat.
https://t.co/Ssj4blS8B0

name: NPR
text:
Sweden's GDP recorded the largest quarterly drop in modern history ‚Äî tumbling 8.6% during the 3-month period ending in June ‚Äî despite the country's decision not to shut down its economy.
https://t.co/1VNkW8AJBt

name: NPR
text:
Federal officials unsealed indictments of 4 managers accused of using unauthorized laborers in several Mississippi food processing plants ‚Äî almost a year after one of the largest workplace raids in U.S. history.
https://t.co/E4F4FjsXpS

text:

name: NPR
text:
Some scientists are calling for more research into adjuvants, which are added to vaccines to enhance the body's immune response, because of data that suggests they may be able to prevent disease all by themselves.
https://t.co/q9uIkp5COL

name: NPR
text: Whatever you expected from Tamsyn Muir's followup to her lesbian-necromancers-in-space epic, "Harrow the Ninth" is not that book ‚Äî it's something wilder, darker and much, much weirder. https://t.co/84I9N162Zq

name: NPR
text:
The essays in Melissa Faliveno‚Äôs ‚ÄúTomboyland‚Äù are a love letter to, reckoning with, and examination of her midwestern upbringing.
https://t.co/Q12KGOtCU1

name: NPR
text:
A steel razor blade can get dull surprisingly quickly when cutting something as soft as hair.

Researchers have gotten their first up-close look at how a close shave actually damages a disposable razor. https://t.co/3vcx6X2yaT

name: NPR
text:
Artist Ekene Ijeoma is an MIT professor who draws on sound and data to explore representations of social justice. 

He‚Äôs working on a ‚Äúvoice portrait‚Äù of the census, composed of Americans counting in languages they grew up speaking. https://t.co/GkAsSilG3o

name: NPR
text:
"In a battle for facts, in a battle for truth, journalism is activism," says Philippine journalist Maria Ressa.

A film focuses on how Ressa ‚Äî who faces the possibility of jail ‚Äî navigates President Rodrigo Duterte's attacks on the press. 
https://t.co/HI5Qj8YlqD

name: NPR
text: The emphasis placed by curators and reenactors at Mount Vernon has changed over the years. Right now, it's less about George Washington's accomplishments, and more about how they were made possible by his slaves' hard work. @wamu885 https://t.co/k8kF5TaMym

name: NPR
text:
Fair Wayne Bryant will continue to spend his life in prison for stealing a pair of hedge clippers after the Louisiana Supreme Court denied his request to review the sentence.
https://t.co/iiCX2SoRt8
